I was in your shoes and itâ€™s been a long process to unlearn those behavior patterns (Iâ€™m still working on it!). Do you have a therapist? If not, I suggest finding a therapist who specializing in DBT (Dialectical Behavioral Therapy). DBT can be useful in treating BPD, mood disorders, suicidal ideation, and for change in behavioral patterns such as self-harm, and substance abuse.

DBT has been life changing for me. Itâ€™s a painful process to reprogram my behaviors but individuals with BPD and individuals with only some indicators of BPD (Iâ€™m the latter) have had success with it. 

If you canâ€™t afford or donâ€™t have access to therapy, there are a ton of DBT resources and workbooks available online. I also recommend the podcast â€œThe Skillful Podcastâ€ which specializes in DBT. 

Hang in there, it can and will get better. The good news is that with time and work, you can get better. Youâ€™re not alone!
